verses.verse: Remember, <WH2142> O LORD,<WH3068> what<WH4100> is come<WH1961> upon us: consider,<WH5027> and behold<WH7200> <WH853> our reproach.<WH2781>
Our inheritance<WH5159> is turned<WH2015> to strangers,<WH2114> our houses<WH1004> to aliens.<WH5237>
We are<WH1961> orphans<WH3490> and fatherless,<WH369> <WH1> our mothers<WH517> are as widows.<WH490>
We have drunken<WH8354> our water<WH4325> for money;<WH3701> our wood<WH6086> is sold<WH935> <WH4242> unto us.
Our necks<WH6677> are under<WH5921> persecution:<WH7291> we labor,<WH3021> and have no rest.<WH3808> <WH5117>
We have given<WH5414> the hand<WH3027> to the Egyptians,<WH4714> and to the Assyrians,<WH804> to be satisfied<WH7646> with bread.<WH3899>
Our fathers<WH1> have sinned,<WH2398> and are not;<WH369> and we<WH587> have borne<WH5445> their iniquities.<WH5771>
Servants <WH5650> have ruled over<WH4910> us: there is none<WH369> that doth deliver<WH6561> us out of their hand.<WH4480> <WH3027>
We got<WH935> our bread<WH3899> with the peril of our lives<WH5315> because of<WH4480> <WH6440> the sword<WH2719> of the wilderness.<WH4057>
Our skin<WH5785> was black<WH3648> like an oven<WH8574> because of<WH4480> <WH6440> the terrible<WH2152> famine.<WH7458>
They ravished<WH6031> the women<WH802> in Zion,<WH6726> and the maids<WH1330> in the cities<WH5892> of Judah.<WH3063>
Princes <WH8269> are hanged up<WH8518> by their hand:<WH3027> the faces<WH6440> of elders<WH2205> were not<WH3808> honored.<WH1921>
They took<WH5375> the young men<WH970> to grind,<WH2911> and the children<WH5288> fell<WH3782> under the wood.<WH6086>
The elders<WH2205> have ceased<WH7673> from the gate,<WH4480> <WH8179> the young men<WH970> from their music.<WH4480> <WH5058>
The joy<WH4885> of our heart<WH3820> is ceased;<WH7673> our dance<WH4234> is turned<WH2015> into mourning.<WH60>
The crown<WH5850> is fallen<WH5307> from our head:<WH7218> woe<WH188> unto us, that<WH3588> we have sinned!<WH2398>
For <WH5921> this<WH2088> our heart<WH3820> is<WH1961> faint;<WH1739> for<WH5921> these<WH428> things our eyes<WH5869> are dim.<WH2821>
Because of<WH5921> the mountain<WH2022> of Zion,<WH6726> which<WH7945> is desolate,<WH8074> the foxes<WH7776> walk<WH1980> upon it.
Thou, <WH859> O LORD,<WH3068> remainest<WH3427> forever;<WH5769> thy throne<WH3678> from generation<WH1755> to generation.<WH1755>
Wherefore <WH4100> dost thou forget<WH7911> us forever,<WH5331> and forsake<WH5800> us so long<WH753> time?<WH3117>
Turn <WH7725> thou us unto<WH413> thee, O LORD,<WH3068> and we shall be turned;<WH7725> renew<WH2318> our days<WH3117> as of old.<WH6924>
But <WH3588> <WH518> thou hast utterly rejected<WH3988> <WH3988> us; thou art very wroth<WH7107> <WH5704> <WH3966> against<WH5921> us.
